author: Douglas Belkin
title: Schools Have a Duty to Protect Students From Attacks, Rules California High Court
text:
The California Supreme Court ruled Thursday that the University of California can be held liable for failing to protect a student from an attack by a classmate.
The decision, which comes as school shootings have become more regular occurrences across the nation, represents a potential signal that courts expect schools to be more proactive to protect their students.
